comment: I took Dr. Xu for a Deep Learning class. We learned about modern AI and real-world examples relating to it. We had around 4 test/ quizzes and 1 project. Study guides are essentially identical to the test. Project could be substituted for a paper. Fair grader. He is an understanding professor and wants to create meaningful work.

Summer 2018 online class, dropped the class before drop/add deadline. Why you might ask? Summer semester is an 8-week session. This guy posted nothing the first week aka 1/8 of the class. No material. No communication. I've seen this before - this guy is another Ermias Mamo. Doesn't teach unless you complain to the dept. AVOID, at least if online.

Took for algorithms analysis. Uses Facebook for attendance and most of the stuff is on Google Drive. Clearly knows his stuff but class can be a bit disorganized and he isnt always clear with what he wants. Material is easy to learn.

Attendance is the largest part of his class.  He is a lousy lecturer and grades very lightly on easy assignments and test.  He is a nice guy though so that's something.  Take for free grade not to learn.  As a grad student, I'm there to learn.  This is why I am giving him a failing grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Xu is a great professor. He cares about his students and he wants you to come out with an A. He will literally never give anything below a 60, which is a C in his class. He also teaches algorithms very well, and you come out of the class with a good understanding of the material, if you pay attention that is.

He is awesome, very nice guy. He knows his stuff especially algorithm analysis.  He is great and tests are relatively easy.  sample tests are online and real test follows same  format. He cares about students and extends deadlines to finish assignments

Xu was a pretty decent professor.  He was rough at the beginning, but he does really care.  Class feedback does wonders with him.  He didn't know how to communicate what he expected at first, but he figured it out.  While I don't know I'd take him again due to the short turn-in time for labs, he was good.  Tests aren't too bad.  He has an accent.

He's honestly one of the best teacher at KSU. He cares for his students, is flexible if need him. His sample exams are just like the test, his lab aren't too bad, and his grading is straight forward, no bs basically. The only thing that might be a problem is that he does have a thick accent so it might be hard to understand him, but really thats it

Prof. Xu is probably one of the best professors at KSU. He is very humble and tries his best to teach his students. The test are similar to his study guides. He is fair with grading as well which a B for him is from 89 to 70. So if your final grade is a 72, he considers it a B. Definitely recommend this professor.

He cares for the student and isn't a tough grader. He understands that sometimes life gets in the way and make the test flexible for the whole class where we can take it online in class. Also, if he see the class struggling then he would adjust the original plan.

Xu is not bad at all. Class is mostly him talking and then letting students try to solve a problem. Class grades are 2 test, 1 final, HW, attendance/quizzes. Algorithms covers things taught in DS at first so it's pretty easy.  He gives study guides for his tests which are similar to the actual test. Not exactly but it helps you understand concepts.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
